name: WP Dash Support
author: Moe Loubani

sections.description:
A simple plugin that you can use that will let your clients contact you from right on their dashboard. The email you get
from them will include a bunch of diagnostic info that you can use to help get an idea about the problem.

This includes:

  • PHP Version
  • Server type (Apache / Ngnix)
  • MySQL version
  • WordPress version
  • Site URL
  • Active plugins
  • Inactive plugins
  • And more!

If you have any questions feel free to visit my website http://www.moeloubani.com and ask.

Enjoy!
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/wpdashsupport directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Make sure to set your developer email in the general settings area
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/wpdashsupport directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Make sure to set your developer email in the general settings area

Where can I find the settings page after I’ve hidden it?

To get back to your settings page just go to http://yourwpsite.com/wp-admin/options.php?page=dash_support_settings
sections.changelog:
1.1.2

  • Fixed bug with email field named wrong

1.1.1

  • Fixed bug with missing file

1.1

  • Added a settings page under the Settings area
  • Added option to customize message above form
  • Added a way to hide the settings once they are set
  • Added an admin notice on activation to bug you until you set a developer email

1.0

  • First version of the plugin

short_description: A plugin that adds a contact form on the dashboard for developers to use to give clients an easier way to contact them.
